name: syntomic
description: A morphism $f : X \to Y$ of schemes is syntomic at $x \in X$ if there exists an affine open neighborhood $U = \Spec A \subset X$ of $x$ and an affine open $V = \Spec B \subset Y$ with $f(U) \subset V$ such that the induced ring morphism $B \to A$ is syntomic, i.e. of finite presentation, makes $A$ into a flat $B$-module, and all the fiber rings $A \otimes_B \kappa(\mathfrak{p})$ are local complete intersections. The morphism $f$ is syntomic if it is syntomic at each $x \in X$.
